com.hiddenswitch.spellsource

Interface Accounts


  • public interface Accounts
    The accounts services. Provides a way for end users to create accounts, get account data, and authenticate users.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER 
      static java.lang.String RESET_TOKENS
      This constant is the name of the collection that stores reset tokens for a specific email address.
      static java.util.regex.Pattern USERNAME_PATTERN
      This pattern specifies what characters make a valid username.
      static java.lang.String USERS
      The USERS constant specifies the name of the collection in Mongo that contains the user data.

        Returns:

      • createAccount

        @NotNull
static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.CreateAccountResponse createAccount(com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.CreateAccountRequest request)
                                                                                 throws com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution,
                                                                                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Creates an account.
        Parameters:
        request - A username, password and e-mail needed to create the account.
        Returns:
        The result of creating the account. If the field contains bad username, bad e-mail or bad password flags set to true, the account creation failed with the specified handled reason. On subsequent requests from a client that's using the HTTP API, the Login Token should be put into the X-Auth-Token header for subsequent requests. The token and user ID should be saved.
        Throws:
        com.github.fromage.quasi.fibers.SuspendExecution
        java.lang.InterruptedException

        static java.lang.String securedPassword(java.lang.String password)

        Parameters:
        password - The user password, typically in plaintext.
        Returns:
        The SCrypted password.

      • isValidPassword

        static boolean isValidPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Validates that a password is not null and at least of length 1.
        Parameters:
        password - The password, in plaintext, to check.
        Returns:
        true if the password is not null and its length is at least 1.

      • login

        @Suspendable
static com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.LoginResponse login(com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.models.LoginRequest request)
        Login with the provided email and password to receive a login token. Pass the login token in the X-Auth-Token header for subsequent requests in the HTTP API. Save the user ID.
        Parameters:
        request - An email and password combination.
        Returns:
        The result of logging in, or information about why the login failed if it was for a handled reason (bad email or password).
